definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
making up a group, forming a troupe (idiom); in large numbers/as a large crowd
in groups of three or four (idiom)

sentences.english: Horses are herded to safety away from the volcanic cloud.
sentences.chinese: 成群的马匹正飞奔逃离火山熔岩灰雾。

sentences.english: Seeing roaches swarm is absolutely disgusting, so be prepared.
sentences.chinese: 看小强成群的爬肯定很恶心，所以要有心理准备。

sentences.english: Of course there are still some certain group-forming tendencies.
sentences.chinese: 当然，它们仍然有某些成群结队的倾向。

sentences.english: Health in the central part of the island to a famous temple monkeys, and monkeys in droves.
sentences.chinese: 在岛中部的生宜有著名的猴子庙，猴子成群结队。

sentences.english: People are thronging to see his new play .
sentences.chinese: 人们成群结队地去看他那出新戏。

sentences.english: Bees swarmed about in the orchard.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂成群地在果园里飞来飞去。

sentences.english: Sometimes it is more deadly and destructive than a swarm of locusts.
sentences.chinese: 有时它比成群的蝗虫更加致命，更具破坏力。

sentences.english: For mount Sion, because it is destroyed, foxes have walked upon it.
sentences.chinese: 因为熙雍山已经荒芜，狐狸成群出没其间。

sentences.english: As soon as the gates were opened, crowds of football supporters piled in.
sentences.chinese: 门一打开，成群的为足球赛呐喊助威的人涌了进来。

sentences.english: In this region, the draw for the sharks mostly consisted of small crustaceans and shrimp.
sentences.chinese: 在这片区域，吸引它们的是成群的甲壳纲动物和虾。

sentences.english: County right to dump his family owned the rich and powerful, Wives and Concubines, many proxy.
sentences.chinese: 他权倾州县，家资豪富，妻妾成群，仆从众多。

sentences.english: North flocks old tenants left Beijing property market why splendor faded?
sentences.chinese: 成群老住户的离开京北楼市为何光彩褪色？

sentences.english: The spectators trooped out of the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 观众成群结队地走出体育场。

sentences.english: Ants climb the wall, before the big rain.
sentences.chinese: 蚂蚁成群爬上墙，雨水淋湿大屋梁。

sentences.english: It is a natural grazing land. Every early summer, flocks of wild ducks fly here, perching and breeding.
sentences.chinese: 每当夏初，成群的野鸭飞来栖息，繁殖后代。

sentences.english: She was forced to live in a cockroach-infested house.
sentences.chinese: 她被迫住在一间蟑螂成群的房子里。

definition: making up a group, forming a troupe (idiom); in large numbers/as a large crowd
in groups of three or four (idiom)
to fly as a flock/to flock together
(of a bird) to peck at food
to come and go/to roam about (mostly unseen)/(of a ghost) to haunt (a place)/(of a criminal) to stalk (the streets)/(of the sun) to rise and set
hundreds/a large number/lit. by the hundreds and thousands
(bird species of China) little egret (Egretta garzetta)
to forage/to hunt for food/to scavenge/fig. to make a living
